#Text=Sudanese teenager sentenced to death for killing husband while raping her
#Text=Sunday , May 13 , 2018
#Text=On Thursday , a court in Omdurman , Sudan , confirmed death penalty for a nineteen-year-old woman , Noura Hussein who was previously found guilty of premeditated murder of her husband .
#Text=Hussein , who was married to Abdulrahman Hammad at the age of sixteen , said she stabbed her husband in self-defence during a second rape .
#Text=Hammad 's family declined money for Hammad 's killing , and the shari'a court announced death by hanging .
#Text=Hussein said she was married at the age of sixteen against her will , after which she took shelter at her aunt 's home for three years .
#Text=According to reports , when Hussein was nineteen , she returned home to visit but her father sent her to her in-laws .
#Text=She refused to have sex with Hammad and she said she was raped six days later by her husband with assistance from Hammad 's relatives .
#Text=She stabbed Hammad the next day when he tried to rape her again .
#Text=According to Amnesty International , Noura Hussein 's father handed her to police after she fled to her home after stabbing Hammad .
#Text=Sudan is a Muslim -majority country governed by shari'a law .
#Text=Marital rape and child marriage are not illegal in Sudan .
#Text=The legal age for girls to get married is the age of ten with the consent of guardians .
#Text=Noura Hussein said the conviction for murder was " shocking moment " but said she knew she would be executed .
#Text=" It was a shocking moment when the judge convicted me with murder .

#Text= An online petition campaign for Noura Hussein 's defence was launched on change.org and Equality Now , and #JusticeForNoura hashtags were trending on Twitter .

column1: #Text=Equality Now said they were writing a mercy plea to the Sudanese president Omar al-Bashir .
#Text=Equality Now 's Global Director Yasmeen Hassan said , " Noura is a victim , not a criminal , and should be treated as such .
